website:

        text: Home
      - about.qmd
    right:
      - icon: github
        href: https://github.com/yourusername

text:
GitHub Integration
To integrate with GitHub:

Initialize a Git repository:
git init
Add your files:
git add .
Commit changes:
git commit -m "Initial commit"
Link to GitHub:
git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/your-repo.git
Push to GitHub:
git push -u origin main

Return to Index ```
This example shows various Quarto features including callouts, code execution, cross-referencing, and margin notes. The GitHub integration steps are included, and the return button is placed at the very end of the document.

project:type: Defines project type

Options: website (creates multi-page site), book (creates book-like structure), default (single document)

website:title: Sets website title in browser tab and navbar
navbar:background: Sets navbar’s background color

Options: primary (blue), secondary (gray), success (green), danger (red), warning (yellow), info (light blue), light (white), dark (black)

navbar:left: Configures left-aligned navbar items (can also be right)

Options: text (displays text, e.g., “Home”), icon (uses icon instead of text), href (specifies link destination)
